dialogues.text: Tucker looks a little bleary-eyed but he’s freshly shower and hastily yanking on his tuxedo. The room service menu open on the bed and he’s on the room phone. *

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. I know. I don’t care. * The biggest one you got. ASAP. Now! * Tucker hangs up as he zips his fly, done getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banquet hall is beautiful. Large bay windows frame th elegant wedding reception inside. It’s an idyllic scene broken only by workers setting things up on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maid of honor is finishing her speech. Tucker slides quietly and settles against the bar. He whispers somethin the bartender, who nods, and sneaks him some money.

dialogues.speaker: MAID OF HONOR
dialogues.text: And after that, I knew she’d met a keeper. And I was right. I love you Kristy! Everyone toasts and politely claps. The BEST MAN, Jeff's brother, picks up the mic. He is sweating and nervous. ANGLE ON Tucker at the bar. He motions to the bartender f beer. *  97.

dialogues.speaker: WEDDING BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Four bucks.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, I am Jeff’s older brother.

dialogues.speaker: WEDDING BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Cash bar.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Who has a cash bar at a wedding? Tucker reluctantly pays as we ANGLE BACK on the best man.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: I’ve known him his whole life, and boy are my arms tired. No response. ANGLE ON Aaron, sitting at a table with Lara

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Bet that joke killed on his blog. ANGLE on Best Man.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: Uh, when Jeff told me he’d met the girl he wanted to marry, I couldn't believe it. Only a few short years ago, he was throwing rocks at girls, and now, he is putting one on...her finger. ANGLE on Tucker, standing at the back of the room. BEST MAN (CONT’D) I have known Kristy for a few years now, and I couldn’t have asked for a better sister-in-law. Here is to my little bro and his bride. Everyone toasts. Tucker walks to the front and takes the microphone from Best Man.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: (to Jeff's brother) Gimme that mic, Sling Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the mic) Some of you may not know me, my name is Tucker Max. Jeff is my best friend. Or at least was, until last week when I took advantage of his kindness and loyalty. I forced him into lying to Kristy, dragged him two hours away, got him abusively drunk, and then ditched him to sleep with a midget stripper. I am the reason that, on the most important day of his life, Jeff's face looks like a melted Barbie doll's. Kristy’s mother is nearly apoplectic. Jeff, holding back building fury, scoots his chair out to get up, but Kristy puts her hand on his leg to stop him and keep him seated.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The worst part is that I didn't know I was doing anything wrong. I was just doing what I’ve always done; which is pretty much whatever the hell I want. And to be honest, it's worked out pretty well for me up to about 24 hours ago. When my selfishness finally caught up with me and cost me Jeff’s friendship, and my invitation to his wedding. Aaron and Lara look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still, I shrugged it off and went out anyway. I won't bore you with the particulars but the long and short of it is, I got drunk and ended the night sprinting across the hotel lobby, uncontrollably shitting my pants. Gasps across the audience.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No really, I crapped all over the lobby. And following my selfish pattern, I left the mess and went back to my room like nothing happened. More gasps. + eH + eH  99.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The only thing that prevented me from passing out in a pile of my own puke was all the knocking at my door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker opens his hotel room door, to see the maid, eyes s red with tears.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was the hotel maid. A mop and bucket in her hands that she thrusts at Tucker. TUCKER (V.O.) (CONT’D) Staring into her angry, overworked face, I had a moment of clarity: Someone else always cleans up my mess, and for the past few years, it's been Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: At three in the morning, on my knees, literally cleaning up my shit for the first time in my adult life, I finally understood what an amazing person Jeff is, and how lucky I am...was...to call him my friend. Tucker turns to look at Jeff and Kristy with real sinceri choking up a little.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jeff, Kristy, I hope you can accept my sincere apology. When I came to your hotel room last night to say sorry, I honestly didn't understand what I was apologizing for. But over the past 24 hours, it's hit me like, well, like ten pounds of slippery shit. I've been a horrible friend. And even though I probably don't deserve to have either of you in my life, I had to come here to tell you that and to ask you for your forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 100. ANGLE on Jeff and Kristy, who look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know this will probably scare the crap out of most of you, but I hope to have kids someday. I am sure I will only have daughters, and they will all be vicious sluts who sleep with assholes just like me and then throw it in my face. But such is karma. If one is a boy, though, I will consider myself a huge success as a father if he grows up to be half the man that Jeff Smith is right now. ANGLE ON the room. Expressions have softened, the room is quiet, some still unsure what to think. ANGLE ON Aaron an Lara.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (crying) That’s so sweet. Aaron rolls his eyes. ANGLE ON Tucker, who has turned to address Jeff directly.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Jeff, I have never thanked you, never acknowledged you, never really even thought about it. I just took from you, dude. I’m really sorry. And for once, I want to give you something back. Tucker motions to the bartender, who flips a set of switc that pull back the drapes on the bay windows behind the h table, revealing a huge bouncy castle on the lawn. KRISTY’S MOTHER Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: OH YES
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts with laughter and applause. The children outside to play in it. Tucker sets the mike down and hugs Jeff and Kristy and they toast to the bride and groom.
Everyone is drinking. Guys and kids play in the bouncy castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 101. Tucker dances with the grandma, flirts with girls, tells hilarious story as the center of attention. Aaron refuses dance despite Lara’s seductive stripper moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, Kristy, Aaron, and Tucker are standing at the bar a the end of the night, ties undone, just the four of them. They look content.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTY
dialogues.text: Tucker, I have to say, when you got up there, I almost died. I had no idea what you were going to do. But that was a great speech.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Thank you. You deserve it. I owe you and Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, you do. Kristy and Tucker hug.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTY
dialogues.text: I have to go check on the guests. Kristy walks off.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: So...did you really fuck a midget?

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: When she’s riding you, can you spin her like a top?

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: I tried, but her vagina was too shallow. Physics were all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Did you really shit the lobby?

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Did you really clean it up?  104 105 102.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Well, the maid did show up at my room with a mop and a bucket. But you guys have known me for many years. What do you think Tucker would do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker opens the door. The maid, eyes still red with tear thrusts a mop at him. He refuses it. She thrusts it at hi again. He pulls out a $20 bill. She refuses. He pulls out another $20. She accepts them and Tucker closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I knew it! You don’t even do your own laundry.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You didn't clean it up? You stand up at my wedding, pour your heart out, and it's all bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: It’s not all bullshit. I don’t need to actually clean up the mess to learn the lesson.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I don’t even know why this shocks me anymore. Jeff and Aaron look at Tucker with a mixture of bemusemen and amused disbelief. Before anyone says another word, a comes into frame, leading a CUTE GIRL toward the ballroom doors. It’s a seeing eye dog. The cute girl is blind. A b As recognition of the blind girl settles over the trio, t mischievous glimmer returns to Tucker’s eye and they see

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Tucker breaks for the cute blind girl as we...

dialogues.speaker: MAIN TITLES
dialogues.text: + eH
